title: [BUG] worktree-create skill loops don't execute - \! prefix only works on single lines
close_reason: Fixed by moving loop logic to library functions in worktree-lib.sh

comments.author: robert
comments.text:
## Problem

The `!for` loop syntax in skill markdown doesn't work as intended. Only lines that directly start with `!` are executed as bash commands. The body of loops is displayed as text but NOT executed.

## Example (worktree-create.md)

```markdown
!for branch in "$@"; do
  BRANCH_NAME="$branch"
  git worktree add -b "$BRANCH_NAME" "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$CURRENT_BRANCH"  # NOT EXECUTED
done
```

The `git worktree add` inside the loop never runs - it's just echoed as text. The skill appears to succeed but no worktree is created.

## Affected Commands

- `/dots-dev:worktree-create`
- `/dots-dev:worktree-delete` 
- Likely others using for loops

## Fix

Refactor skills to use helper functions in `scripts/worktree-lib.sh` instead of inline loops.

title: [feature] Auto-detect Xcode projects and use sibling worktrees
description: Worktree creation should auto-detect Xcode projects (*.xcodeproj) and create worktrees as siblings instead of nested in .worktrees/ to avoid Swift Package Manager local dependency path resolution issues. Detection: check for *.xcodeproj in repo root. If found, use ../$(basename $repo)-wt-$name pattern instead of .worktrees/$name pattern.
design: Detection: Look for *.xcodeproj files in the root of the git repo (e.g., ls *.xcodeproj 2>/dev/null). If found, create worktree as sibling using pattern: ../$(basename $PWD)-wt-$name. Otherwise, use existing nested pattern: .worktrees/$name. Modify the worktree-create skill to add this detection logic before the git worktree add command.
acceptance_criteria: 1. Xcode project (has *.xcodeproj): Creates worktree as sibling (../<repo>-wt-<name>), can build in Xcode without SPM path errors. 2. Non-Xcode project: Creates worktree in .worktrees/<name> as before. 3. Verify with real repos: test with Yap (Xcode) and another non-Xcode repo. 4. Git worktree list shows correct paths for both cases.

title: Continue command doesn't properly detect worktrees
description:
The `/dots-swe:continue` command shows sessions as '(no worktree)' even when git worktrees exist.

Example:
```
You have two available sessions you can continue with:
  1. dots-claude-plugins-7vd (no worktree)
  2. test (no worktree)
```

But `git worktree list` shows:
```
/Users/robert/repos/objectiveous/GammaKit/.worktrees/gk-6xv.3  c188130 [gk-6xv.3]
```

The continue script isn't properly detecting or associating worktrees with sessions.
close_reason: Fixed worktree detection. Continue command now uses lsof to get actual working directory from session PID, allowing it to detect worktrees across all repositories. Version bumped to 1.1.2.

title: Fix commit and merge hygiene to follow Conventional Commits
design:
## Problem
Current commit/merge practices violate Conventional Commits and will cause problems at scale:
1. Merge commits use generic messages like 'Merge branch X' instead of summarizing work
2. No squashing strategy - feature branches dump many micro-commits to main
3. Commit hook doesn't handle merge commits properly
4. bd sync commits bypass conventions (LOW PRIORITY)

## Expert Best Practices (2026)
- Main branch should contain one commit per feature/fix
- Feature branches can have many commits, but squash before merge
- Merge commits should follow Conventional Commits format and summarize work
- Commit hooks should allow/validate merge commits differently

## Design Approach

### 1. Local Merge Workflow (Primary)
Since only one developer and local CI/CD:
- Update merge commands to prompt for Conventional Commit message
- Include summary of branch changes in merge commit body
- Use --no-ff to preserve branch topology

### 2. Squashing Strategy
- Add pre-merge squash step to workflow
- Guide users through interactive rebase
- Keep main branch clean with logical commits

### 3. Commit Hook Enhancement
- Detect merge commits (start with 'Merge')
- Allow merge commits to pass (different validation)
- Continue validating regular commits

### 4. Documentation Updates
- Update SWE agent with squash workflow
- Update all commands to reference squashing
- Add examples of good merge messages

## Out of Scope
- GitHub PR title validation (no GitHub CI/CD)
- GitHub Actions (using local CI/CD)
- Multi-developer coordination (single dev currently)
- bd sync commit format (LOW PRIORITY - defer to later)
acceptance_criteria:
## Exit Criteria

### Merge Commits Follow Convention
- Merge commands generate Conventional Commit messages
- Merge messages include type(scope): description format
- Merge commit body summarizes changes from branch
- Example: 'feat(auth): add OAuth integration' not 'Merge branch oauth'

### Squashing Workflow Implemented
- Documentation explains when/how to squash commits
- SWE agent includes squashing in workflow
- Helper command exists for interactive rebasing
- Main branch shows clean, logical commit history

### Commit Hook Handles Merges
- Hook allows merge commits to pass
- Hook still validates regular commits
- No false rejections of valid merge commits
- Can complete a merge without hook errors

### Documentation Updated
- SWE agent includes squash workflow
- Merge commands reference Conventional Commits format
- Examples show good vs bad commit messages
- Quick reference cards updated

### Manual Testing
Test 1: Merge with conventional commit message works
Test 2: Squashing workflow guides through rebase
Test 3: Hook validation still works for bad messages
Test 4: Regular conventional commits pass

## Success Metrics
- Zero non-conventional commits in main branch (except historical)
- Average 1-3 commits per feature (not 10-20 micro-commits)
- All merge commits follow type(scope): format
- Commit hook has 0% false positive rate

title: Update merge commands to use Conventional Commit format
description:
Fix dots-dev/commands/worktree-merge.md to generate proper Conventional Commit merge messages instead of generic 'Merge branch X'.

Current: git merge <branch> --no-ff -m "Merge branch '<branch>'"
Target: Prompt for conventional message and include change summary
design:
## Current Implementation
dots-dev/commands/worktree-merge.md:39 uses generic merge message

## New Implementation
1. Before merge, show git log main..branch --oneline
2. Prompt user for Conventional Commit message:
   - Type (feat/fix/chore/refactor/etc)
   - Scope (optional)
   - Description
3. Generate merge commit with:
   - Subject: type(scope): description
   - Body: summary of commits being merged
   - Footer: 'Merged branch: <branch-name>'

## Example
Subject: feat(auth): add OAuth integration
Body:
- Add OAuth 2.0 provider configuration
- Implement token refresh logic
- Add session management

Merged branch: feature/oauth
acceptance_criteria:
- Merge command prompts for conventional commit info
- Generated message follows type(scope): description format
- Merge commit body includes summary of changes
- Hook validation passes on merge commits
- Test with actual branch merge completes successfully

description:
Add new command that guides users through squashing commits in their feature branch.

design:

New file: dots-swe/commands/squash.md

1. Check if on feature branch (not main)

3. Show commit count and list
4. Offer to start interactive rebase
5. Provide guidance during rebase

Commits to squash: 3
dfc930a wip: c
c900242 wip: b
59532f2 wip: a

Starting interactive rebase...
In the editor:
  - Keep first commit as 'pick'
  - Change others to 'squash' (keep message) or 'fixup' (discard message)
  - Save and close
  - Write final Conventional Commit message

title: Fix permission denied error on continue.sh script
description:
When executing the continue skill, users get:
```
Error: Exit code 126
(eval):1: permission denied: /Users/robert/.claude/plugins/cache/dots-claude-plugins/dots-swe/1.1.0/scripts/continue.sh
```

The script file is not executable. Workaround is to call with `bash` explicitly:
```
bash "$(ls -td $HOME/.claude/plugins/cache/dots-claude-plugins/dots-swe/*/scripts/continue.sh 2>/dev/null | head -1)"
```

Root cause: scripts are not being installed with execute permissions.
close_reason: Fixed script permissions. Scripts continue.sh, finish.sh, and swe-lib.sh now have execute permissions (mode 755). Version bumped to 1.1.1.
